[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/asymmetric_encryption/mod.rs] [Trait: AsymmetricEncryption::key_gen()] [Weak RNG] Can an attacker predict private keys if the RNG implementation passed to key_gen() has insufficient entropy, potentially compromising all encrypted data and enabling fund theft? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/asymmetric_encryption/mod.rs] [Trait: AsymmetricEncryption::key_gen()] [RNG state manipulation] Does the trait enforce that the RNG is properly seeded, or can an attacker manipulate RNG state to generate known private keys enabling decryption of all messages? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/asymmetric_encryption/mod.rs] [Trait: AsymmetricEncryption::key_gen()] [Key validation] Does the trait specification require validation that generated keys are in the correct mathematical group, or can invalid keys lead to weak encryption enabling cryptanalysis? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/asymmetric_encryption/mod.rs] [Trait: AsymmetricEncryption] [Type safety] Can implementors use incompatible PrivateKey and PublicKey types that break the encryption scheme's mathematical properties, leading to trivial decryption attacks? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/asymmetric_encryption/mod.rs] [Trait: AsymmetricEncryption::key_gen()] [Deterministic generation] Can the same RNG seed produce identical keypairs across different nodes, allowing an attacker who compromises one node to decrypt messages intended for other nodes? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/asymmetric_encryption/mod.rs] [Trait: AsymmetricEncryption::enc()] [Dual RNG requirement] Why does enc() require two separate RNG instances (R1 and R2), and can using the same RNG for both lead to nonce reuse or randomness correlation enabling ciphertext forgery? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/asymmetric_encryption/mod.rs] [Trait: AsymmetricEncryption::enc()] [Public key validation] Does the trait require validation that the input public key is valid before encryption, or can malformed keys cause encryption to fail silently or leak plaintext? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/asymmetric_encryption/mod.rs] [Trait: AsymmetricEncryption::enc()] [Nonce uniqueness] Does the trait guarantee nonce uniqueness across all encryptions, or can nonce reuse with the same key enable attackers to XOR ciphertexts and recover plaintexts? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/asymmetric_encryption/mod.rs] [Trait: AsymmetricEncryption::enc()] [Empty message handling] How does the trait handle encryption of empty messages, and can this reveal information about the encryption scheme or enable distinguishing attacks? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/asymmetric_encryption/mod.rs] [Trait: AsymmetricEncryption::enc()] [Message length limits] Does the trait enforce maximum message length limits, or can arbitrarily large messages cause memory exhaustion DoS attacks on validators? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/asymmetric_encryption/mod.rs] [Trait: AsymmetricEncryption::enc()] [Error propagation] Can encryption errors be silently ignored by implementors, leading to unencrypted data being transmitted or stored, exposing sensitive information? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/asymmetric_encryption/mod.rs] [Trait: AsymmetricEncryption::enc()] [Ciphertext malleability] Does the trait guarantee authenticated encryption, or can attackers modify ciphertexts to change the decrypted plaintext without detection, enabling message tampering? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/asymmetric_encryption/mod.rs] [Trait: AsymmetricEncryption::dec()] [Padding oracle] Does the trait prevent timing differences between valid and invalid ciphertexts during decryption, or can attackers exploit padding oracles to decrypt messages without the private key? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/asymmetric_encryption/mod.rs] [Trait: AsymmetricEncryption::dec()] [Ciphertext validation] Does dec() validate ciphertext format and length before decryption, or can malformed ciphertexts cause crashes or undefined behavior in validator nodes? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/asymmetric_encryption/mod.rs] [Trait: AsymmetricEncryption::dec()] [Authentication bypass] Does the trait require authentication of ciphertexts before decryption, or can attackers forge ciphertexts that decrypt to arbitrary plaintexts? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/asymmetric_encryption/mod.rs] [Trait: AsymmetricEncryption::dec()] [Side-channel resistance] Does the trait specification require constant-time decryption operations, or can timing attacks reveal the private key through repeated decryption attempts? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/asymmetric_encryption/mod.rs] [Trait: AsymmetricEncryption::dec()] [Error handling] Do decryption failures leak information about why decryption failed (invalid key vs corrupted ciphertext), enabling adaptive chosen-ciphertext attacks? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/asymmetric_encryption/mod.rs] [Trait: AsymmetricEncryption::dec()] [Replay attacks] Does the trait provide mechanisms to prevent replay of previously valid ciphertexts, or can attackers resubmit old encrypted messages to cause state confusion? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/asymmetric_encryption/elgamal_curve25519_aes256_gcm.rs] [Function: enc()] [Torsion point validation] Does the is_torsion_free() check prevent small-subgroup attacks where an attacker provides a low-order public key to extract private key bits through oracle queries? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/asymmetric_encryption/elgamal_curve25519_aes256_gcm.rs] [Function: enc()] [AES key derivation] Can the hash_group_element_to_aes_key() function produce colliding AES keys from different ElGamal ciphertexts, allowing decryption with wrong private keys? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/asymmetric_encryption/elgamal_curve25519_aes256_gcm.rs] [Function: hash_group_element_to_aes_key()] [Domain separation] Is the domain separation tag 'DST__AES_KEY_DERIVATION' sufficient to prevent cross-protocol attacks where keys derived for different purposes collide? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/asymmetric_encryption/elgamal_curve25519_aes256_gcm.rs] [Function: enc()] [Nonce generation] Can the AES-GCM nonce generated by Aes256Gcm::generate_nonce() ever repeat with the same AES key, enabling catastrophic nonce reuse attacks that completely break confidentiality? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/asymmetric_encryption/elgamal_curve25519_aes256_gcm.rs] [Function: enc()] [ElGamal randomness reuse] Can the randomness used in ElGamal encryption be reused across multiple encryptions, enabling an attacker to compute private keys by solving discrete log on related ciphertexts? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/asymmetric_encryption/elgamal_curve25519_aes256_gcm.rs] [Function: enc()] [Ciphertext format] Can the serialization format [c0|c1|nonce|aes_ct] be parsed ambiguously, allowing attackers to craft ciphertexts that decrypt differently depending on parsing implementation? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/asymmetric_encryption/elgamal_curve25519_aes256_gcm.rs] [Function: dec()] [Length check bypass] Can an attacker craft ciphertexts shorter than 76 bytes that bypass the length check and cause out-of-bounds reads or memory corruption? (High)
